mods.abstract: $100 Reward! RANAWAY or stolen from the plantation, known as Hutchinson's Magnolia plantation, situated on Red River, Caddo parish, about the 9th of September, the negro boy CHARLES, aged 14 years, about 4 feet, 10 inches high, weighs about 100 lbs., and of black complexion. The above reward of One Hundred Dollars will be paid for the delivery of the negro and the arrest with evidence to convict the person who stole him; or Fifty Dollars for the delivery of the negro to me, or his confinement in the Shreveport jail, or Twenty-five Dollars, for his confinement in any jail, notifying me of the same. JOSEPH G. GILBERT. Knox Point, Bossier parish, La. dec29-4t
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
